intro: Eleocharis spiralis, commonly known as the spiral sedge, is a flowering plant in the Cyperaceae family. It is a short-lived perennial that typically grows in wetlands, marshes, and other moist environments. The plant has slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences that contain tiny, wind-pollinated flowers. Its rhizomatous growth habit allows it to spread and form dense colonies in suitable habitats. Eleocharis spiralis plays an important role in stabilizing soil and providing habitat for aquatic and semi-aquatic organisms.
